summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 between a law firm (Hughes Hubbard & Reed) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding the SDNY's investigation. The SDNY is seeking a transcript of a 2009 deposition of a plaintiff (Virginia Giuffre) from a prior civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. The law firm, representing Epstein's estate, coordinates with the plaintiff's former attorney to confirm no protective order exists before providing the transcript.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to as the plaintiff whose 2009 deposition transcript is being sought by the SDNY for their investigation. The deposition was from a lawsuit where she was represented by the law firm Critton, Luttier, and Coleman.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the prior civil lawsuit from which the deposition transcript originates. He was represented by the law firm Hughes Hubbard & Reed.

connections.description: Giuffre was the plaintiff in a civil lawsuit against Epstein, indicating an alleged victim-perpetrator relationship central to the SDNY investigation.

events.title: Deposition of Virginia Giuffre
events.description: A deposition of Virginia Giuffre was taken in 2009 as part of a prior civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: SDNY Request for Deposition Transcript
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York requests and eventually receives the 2009 deposition transcript of Virginia Giuffre from Epstein's estate attorneys for their investigation.

keyFacts: The SDNY was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of September 2020, seeking evidence from prior civil litigation.
A key piece of evidence sought was the 2009 deposition transcript of Virginia Giuffre from her civil lawsuit against Epstein.
The law firm Hughes Hubbard & Reed, representing Epstein's estate, facilitated the transfer of the transcript after confirming no protective order restricted its disclosure.
The email chain shows coordination between federal prosecutors, defense attorneys for the estate, and the plaintiff's former attorney to obtain the evidence.
